name: chancellorship
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the position of a person of the highest or high rank, especially in a government or university: She was recently a finalist for the chancellorship of the State Colleges and Universities system. His failed bid for the Chancellorship was simply a bump in the road.
UK the position of Chancellor of the Exchequer (= the person in the UK government in charge of tax and government spending): He resigned the chancellorship. The Prime Minister can't leave the Chancellorship vacant. See
chancellor
More examplesFewer examplesThe Freedom Party entered a coalition government with the conservative People's Party under his Chancellorship.He wasn't sure he wanted to give up his political career for the chancellorship. He lost the Chancellorship for his lack of impact.One of the consistent themes of his Chancellorship is that this is a government that meets its economic targets and does not move the goal posts.
